page.title: 08QUARRYING AND PLANNING
page.content: Quarring :Planning considerations. Land for quarring can be either rented from the farmer or in some cases bought outright from him.The land at Kinloch Quarry is rented. Legislation governs the quarrying operation and environmental disruption is kept to a minimum. A belt of trees runs along the quarry perimeters to reduce the visual impact of the proposed excavations. Top soil is removed and stored ready to be replaced later. Depth of working is limited to the level of the water table (down to a depth of two metres) and must not be lower than that of the nearby road. Once the sand and gravel has been removed, then the land is refurbished to requirements and farming will again take place on these quarry sites.
